solution_line_template: The number of books borrowed on Friday is higher by {daily_average} * {friday_increase_percent}/{percent_divisor} = <<{daily_average}*{friday_increase_percent}/{percent_divisor}={friday_increase}>>{friday_increase} books.

There are {days_open} days from Monday to Friday inclusive, so Krystian borrows an average of {days_open} * {daily_average} = <<{days_open}*{daily_average}={total_books_without_friday_increase}>>{total_books_without_friday_increase} books during that time.

With Friday's increase in borrowings, during one week Krystian borrows {total_books_without_friday_increase} + {friday_increase} = <<{total_books_without_friday_increase}+{friday_increase}={total_books_week}>>{total_books_week} books.
